unnormalised: Dr. Rajesh Kumar, a renowned cardiologist, has preponed his visit to the rural healthcare camp in Bihar to 10/11/2024, instead of the previously scheduled date. The early visit comes after reports of a surge in heart-related ailments in the region due to the recent floods.
normalised: Doctor Rajesh Kumar, a renowned cardiologist, has preponed his visit to the rural healthcare camp in Bihar to tenth november two thousand and twenty four, instead of the previously scheduled date. The early visit comes after reports of a surge in heart-related ailments in the region due to the recent floods.

unnormalised: Sources confirm that Prof. Meena Sharma, head of the department of neurology at AIIMS, Delhi, will be joining Dr. Kumar. Prof. Sharma's expertise will be invaluable in addressing neurological complications arising from waterborne diseases.
normalised: Sources confirm that Professor Meena Sharma, head of the department of neurology at A-I-I-M-S, Delhi, will be joining Doctor Kumar. Professor Sharma's expertise will be invaluable in addressing neurological complications arising from waterborne diseases.

unnormalised: The local medical officer, CMO Yadav, expressed his gratitude for the doctors' commitment. He mentioned that the camp will provide free consultations and medication to over 500 patients from the surrounding villages.
normalised: The local medical officer, C-M-O Yadav, expressed his gratitude for the doctors' commitment. He mentioned that the camp will provide free consultations and medication to over five hundred patients from the surrounding villages.

unnormalised: Word on the street is that even Vaidya Ji, known for his traditional Ayurvedic remedies, will be present to offer alternative treatment options alongside conventional medicine. The camp aims to provide a holistic healthcare approach for the community.
normalised: Word on the street is that even Vaidya Ji, known for his traditional Ayurvedic remedies, will be present to offer alternative treatment options alongside conventional medicine. The camp aims to provide a holistic healthcare approach for the community.

unnormalised: This initiative is supported by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare and various NGOs, ensuring that healthcare reaches even the most remote corners of India.
normalised: This initiative is supported by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare and various N-G-Os, ensuring that healthcare reaches even the most remote corners of India.
